Return's True/False in 'have_i_been_accepted'

post.description:
Add new "management hash" with certain permissions. This is not same as users/work-id's promotion to admin.
You should think this as of adding "machine admin permissions". User related admin promotions should
be done using /promote and /demote /lock.

value.service_management_hash: [str] - Hash string having permissions to add hash
value.permissions_str: [str] - Set permission string for new management_hash.

get.description: Check the status for given work_id (enrollment). status=None means that there is no enrollment with given work_id

/list?service_management_hash=dasqdsdasqwe
Return users/work-id's/enrollments. If 'accepted' has something else than '', it has been accepted.
Returns a list of dicts, work_id_list = [ {  "work_id":'x', 'work_id_hash':'yy', 'state':'init', 'accepted':'' } ]

post.description: Add new work_id (enrollment) to environment.

value.user_management_hash: [str] - Hash string having permissions to add work_id_hash
[str] - Hash string having permissions to add work_id_hash

post.description: "Promote" work_id/user/enrollment to have 'admin' rights

value.management_hash: [str] - Hash string used to 'promote' given work_id/user/enrollment

post.description: "Demote" work_id/user/enrollment from having 'admin' rights. work_id_hash can be used too.

value.management_hash: [str] - Hash string used to 'promote' given work_id/user/enrollment

post.description: Lock work_id/user/enrollment so it cannot be used anymore.

value.management_hash: [str] - Hash string used to 'promote' given work_id/user/enrollment

get.description: Deliver download url link using work_id_hash

post.description: Accept work_id_hash (work_id/enrollment) using management_hash

examples.service_management_hash: [str] - Hash string having permissions to accept this query

get.description:
/is-active, basically this one just checks if there is a row with special_rules='first-user' in management table.
If not, then this API is deemed to be "disabled"...

/check-code?temp_admin_code=xxxx,
Checks if the given code can be used or not in this /firstuser api route...

post.description:
This one disables the /firstuser API route. permit_str aka "admin hash" is required.
Cannot be done with temp_admin_code.

This one enables the /firstuser API route. permit_str aka "admin hash" is required.
Cannot be done with temp_admin_code. This was mainly added because pytests kind a needs it.
Add work_id aka username/identity. This work_id is also elevated to have managing permissions.

value.work_id: [str] - id/name for new user that is elevated to admin

post.description: Remove work_id aka username/identity. The work_id's management hash is also removed from management table.

value.work_id: [str] - id/name for user that will be deleted

get.description: Return available 'admin' id's and hashes.
